floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise and will affect locations near to the River Lim, River Char, River Winniford, Simene River, River Brit, River Asker, River Mangerton, River Bride due to heavy rainfall .
River levels will be at their highest between 09:00 PM on the 19/10/21 and 01:00 AM on 20/10/2021.
Heavy rainfall is forecast overnight which will cause river levels to rise.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary.
Consider activating any property flood protection products if available.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 20/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

Some unexpected intense rain this evening means that flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Frome, Hooke River, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Toller Whelme and Dorchester.
River levels will be at their highest between 09:30 PM on the 19/10/21 until 3:00AM on the 20/10/21.
Further rainfall is forecast overnight causing river levels to rise rapidly.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary.
Consider activating any property flood protection products in Maiden Newton if available.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 20/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Tuesday and Wednesday evening. High water on Tuesday at Teignmouth is at 19:00, times of high water will vary along the coast.
The forecast wind and wave conditions will result in rough seas at Torbay. Spray overtopping will result in minor flooding at Torbay, Dawlish, and Teignmouth. Expect tides to be up to 440mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.
Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Teignmouth on Tuesday at 19:00 is 2.38 mAOD, this is 0.25 metres above astronomical tide level. On Wednesday high tide will be at 19:45 with predicted levels of 2.59mAOD, 0.44m above astronomic tide level.

Wednesday afternoon's tide at 12:15 on 20/10/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Westerly Force 7 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.18 m. The total forecast tide is 6.03 metres Chart Datum (2.98 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide wave overtopping will affect the beach front. A very small amount of water may collect on nearby land, fields and at Climping Street Car Park. Tide conditions are forecast to be similar until Friday 22/10/2021, with Wednesday evening's tide likely to be slightly (20cm) higher than Wednesday afternoon's. We continue to monitor the forecast. We may check the condition of the beach at low tide. Shingle and debris can be thrown by large waves. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. Take care if visiting Climping beach. We will update this message by 14:00 on 20/10/2021

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Hayle, Perrancoombe Stream, Bolingey Stream, River Cober, Portreath Stream

items.message:
This flood alert has been triggered by the Portreath Stream river level gauge. 

Following heavy rain during Tuesday evening river levels upstream on the Portreath Stream and other small watercourses have risen rapidly, resulting in surface water flooding and localised flooding of low lying ground and minor roads. 

Further heavy showers are expected over night, and with a further band of rain during Wednesday, river levels may increase further on Wednesday night. 

This alert will be updated by 11am on Wed 20 Oct.
